document_data.name: Gorgon
document_data.mainbody: '''Gorgons''' were large [[magical beast]]s that resembled a bull covered in dusky metallic scales.
document_data.Behavior: Gorgons had an animal level of intelligence. Once a potential threat was petrified a gorgon would instinctively ignore the body.

Sub-Species.Aberrant Gorgons: Gorgons that had been twisted by the [[Far Realm]] powers of [[Gyrion Farseeker]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]]. As opposed to a dusky metallic sheen, these gorgons had a bluish hue to their bodies. A number of [[adventurer]]s in the [[Sword Coast North]] were found to be riding them as [[mount]]s.<ref>
Sub-Species.Cormanthor Gorgons: This regional breed of gorgons had a special ability, which [[Lyra Sunrose|some said]] was granted by the deities of [[the Hexad]]. If they slipped into the river, they turned to stone and were saved from drowning because they no longer needed oxygen or food. Sometimes, these petrified gorgons might be washed onto the shore by a strong current and the sun would warm them, causing them to be restored to their normal form. It was not unknown for fishermen to pull the petrified gorgons out of the river, thinking them to be statues.
Sub-Species.Frozen Gorgons: A species of gorgon created by a mad mage who experimented on replacing gorgons' metallic plates with magical ice.

Ecology.Diet:
Gorgons were omnivorous creatures that required a lot of [[iron]] in their diet to maintain the durability of their scales. This was often obtained from blood and green vegetation.

Gorgons loved to eat fish. The [[Cormanthor]] gorgons flocked to the banks of [[River Ashaba]] and [[Elvenflow]] each spring when they flooded, so that they could collect the fish that were stranded there. Once the supply was depleted, a few of the gorgons were tempted to venture into the river to get more. Some of them fell in as a result, but their special ability could save them (see [[#Cormanthor|Species, Cormanthor]] below).

They were also known to have a fondness for [[deer]] and [[elk]].
Ecology.Habitats: These creatures were typically found to live underground or in plains in regions with a temperate or tropical climate. Many preferred to live in wilderness that was relatively secure and free of danger.

document_data.Uses:
The blood of a gorgon was a magical component used in masonry to prevent [[magic]]al travel through walls. When one drop of blood was mixed with a pint of water during the mixture of stucco or mortar and applied with no unaffected areas larger than a man's head, it would prevent [[astral plane|astral]] and [[ethereal plane|ethereal]] travel through walls. When mixed with [[Rubber|natural rubber]], their blood could further be used as a sealant that prevented detection of magic, [[alignment]], and temperature, such as in the construction of ''[[dead box]]es''.

[[Drow]] in [[Old Shanatar]] used gorgon blood as an ingredient in forging [[gorgon plate]] mail, an armor said to be capable of protecting them against the sun's harmful affects.

Their metallic scales could be used to make [[ink]] for scrolls of ''[[Protection from petrification, 10' radius|protection from petrification]]'' or fashioned into a set of [[scale mail]] that protected against petrification effects.

Gorgon [[milk]] was one of the ingredients in creating the [[hag]] treat known as "Eye Scream", along with [[newt]] eyes, [[blueberries]], and swamp water. The recipe was detailed in ''[[the Witch's Brew Cookbook]].''
